com.mparticle.commerce

Class Cart

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mparticle.commerce.Cart

  • public final class Cart
extends java.lang.Object
    The Cart has a one-to-one relationship with MParticleUsers.

    The Cart will persist state across app-restarts.

    You may access the cart via the MParticleUser object: 

     
 MParticle.getInstance().Identity().getCurrentUser().cart()

    You should not instantiate this class directly

    • Method Detail

      • setMaximumProductCount

        public static void setMaximumProductCount(int maximum)
        Set the maximum product count to hold in the cart. On memory constrained devices/apps, this value can be lowered to avoid possible memory exceptions.
        Parameters:
        maximum -

      • loadFromString

        public void loadFromString(java.lang.String cartJson)
        Reset the cart and re-populate it from a String representation. This method allows you to support multiple carts per user.
        Parameters:
        cartJson - a JSON-encoded string acquired from toString()

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        In addition to providing a human-readable JSON representation of the cart, the output of this method can be stored and then later passed into loadFromString(String) to support multiple-cart use-cases.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a JSON representation of the Cart
        See Also:
        loadFromString(String)

      • clear

        public Cart clear()
        Remove all Products from the Cart. This will not log an event.
        Returns:
        the Cart object for method chaining

      • getProduct

        public Product getProduct(java.lang.String name)
        Find a product by name
        Parameters:
        name - the product name
        Returns:
        a Product object, or null if no matching Products were found.

      • products

        public java.util.List<Product> products()
        Retrieve the current list of Products in the Cart.

        Note that this returns an UnmodifiableCollection that will throw an UnsupportedOperationException if you attempt to add or remove Products.
        Returns:
        an UnmodifiableCollection of Products in the Cart

      • remove

        public Cart remove(Product product)
        Remove one or more products from the Cart and log a CommerceEvent.

        This method will log a CommerceEvent with the Product.REMOVE_FROM_CART action.

        If the Cart already contains a Product that is considered equal, the Product will be removed.
        Parameters:
        product - the product objects to remove from the Cart
        Returns:
        the Cart object, useful for chaining several commands

      • remove

        public Cart remove(Product product,
                   boolean logEvent)
        Remove one or more products from the Cart and log a CommerceEvent.

        This method will log a CommerceEvent with the Product.REMOVE_FROM_CART action.

        If the Cart already contains a Product that is considered equal, the Product will be removed.
        Parameters:
        product - the product to remove from the Cart
        Returns:
        the Cart object, useful for chaining several commands

      • remove

        public boolean remove(int index)
        Remove a product from the Cart by index and log a CommerceEvent.

        This method will log a CommerceEvent with the Product.REMOVE_FROM_CART action.
        Parameters:
        index - of the Product to remove
        Returns:
        boolean determining if a product was actually removed.
        See Also:
        products()

      • addAll

        public Cart addAll(java.util.List<Product> newProducts,
                   boolean logEvent)
        Add one or more products to the Cart and optionally log a CommerceEvent.

        This method will log a CommerceEvent with the Product.ADD_TO_CART action based on the logEvent parameter. Products added here will remain in the cart across app restarts, and will be included in future calls to purchase(TransactionAttributes) or CommerceEvent's with a product action Product.PURCHASE

        Parameters:
        newProducts - the products to add to the Cart
        Returns:
        the Cart object, useful for chaining several commands

      • add

        public Cart add(Product product)
        Add one or more products to the Cart and log a CommerceEvent.

        This method will log a CommerceEvent with the Product.ADD_TO_CART action. Products added here will remain in the cart across app restarts, and will be included in future calls to purchase(TransactionAttributes) or CommerceEvent's with a product action Product.PURCHASE

        If the Cart already contains a Product that is considered equal, this method is a no-op.
        Parameters:
        product - the product to add to the Cart
        Returns:
        the Cart object, useful for chaining several commands

      • add

        public Cart add(Product product,
                boolean logEvent)
        Add one or more products to the Cart and log a CommerceEvent.

        This method will log a CommerceEvent with the Product.ADD_TO_CART action. Products added here will remain in the cart across app restarts, and will be included in future calls to purchase(TransactionAttributes) or CommerceEvent's with a product action Product.PURCHASE

        If the Cart already contains a Product that is considered equal, this method is a no-op.
        Parameters:
        product - the product to add to the Cart
        Returns:
        the Cart object, useful for chaining several commands

      • checkout

        public void checkout(int step,
                     java.lang.String options)
        Log a CommerceEvent with the Product.CHECKOUT action, including the Products that are currently in the Cart. You should call add(Product) prior to this method.
        Parameters:
        step - the checkout progress/step for apps that have a multi-step checkout process
        options - a label to associate with the checkout event

      • checkout

        public void checkout()
        Log a CommerceEvent with the Product.CHECKOUT action, including the Products that are currently in the Cart. You should call add(Product) prior to this method.

      • purchase

        public void purchase(TransactionAttributes attributes)
        Log a CommerceEvent with the Product.PURCHASE action for the Products that are currently in the Cart. By default, this method will *not* clear the cart. You must manually call clear(). You should call add(Product) prior to this method.
        Parameters:
        attributes - the attributes to associate with this purchase

      • purchase

        public void purchase(TransactionAttributes attributes,
                     boolean clearCart)
        Log a CommerceEvent with the Product.PURCHASE action for the Products that are currently in the Cart. You should call add(Product) prior to this method.
        Parameters:
        attributes - the attributes to associate with this purchase
        clearCart - boolean determining if the cart should remove its contents after the purchase

      • refund

        public void refund(TransactionAttributes attributes,
                   boolean clearCart)
        Log a CommerceEvent with the Product.REFUND action for the Products that are currently in the Cart.
        Parameters:
        attributes - the attributes to associate with this refund. Typically at least the transaction ID is required.
